signature_matches.name: allocate or change RWX memory
signature_matches.description: host-interaction/process/inject
signature_matches.rule_src:
rule:
  meta:
    name: allocate or change RWX memory
    namespace: host-interaction/process/inject
    authors:
      - "@mr-tz"
      - mehunhoff@google.com
    scopes:
      static: basic block
      dynamic: call
    mbc:
      - Memory::Allocate Memory [C0007]
    examples:
      - Practical Malware Analysis Lab 03-03.exe_:0x4010EA
      # ntdll
      - 563653399B82CD443F120ECEFF836EA3678D4CF11D9B351BB737573C2D856299:0x140001ABA
  features:
    - or:
      - basic block:
        - and:
          - or:
            - match: allocate memory
            - match: change memory protection
          - or:
            - number: 0x40 = PAGE_EXECUTE_READWRITE
            # lea     r9d, [rcx+40h]  ; flProtect
            # call    cs:VirtualAlloc
            - instruction:
              - mnemonic: lea
              - offset: 0x40 = PAGE_EXECUTE_READWRITE
      - call:
        - and:
          - or:
            - match: allocate memory
            - match: change memory protection
          - number: 0x40 = PAGE_EXECUTE_READWRITE

signature_matches.name: contains PDB path
signature_matches.description: executable/pe/pdb
signature_matches.rule_src:
rule:
  meta:
    name: contains PDB path
    namespace: executable/pe/pdb
    authors:
      - moritz.raabe@mandiant.com
    scopes:
      static: file
      dynamic: file
    examples:
      - 464EF2CA59782CE697BC329713698CCC  # level32.exe
  features:
    - string: /:\\.*\.pdb/

signature_matches.name: stealth_network
signature_matches.description: Network activity detected but not expressed in monitor API logs

signature_matches.name: queries_keyboard_layout
signature_matches.description: Queries the keyboard layout

signature_matches.name: network_http
signature_matches.description: Performs some HTTP requests
Creates a DirectInput object (often for capturing keystrokes)
Sample execution stops while process was sleeping (likely an evasion)
Uses 32bit PE files
PE file has an executable .text section and no other executable section
Reads software policies
PE file contains a mix of data directories often seen in goodware
Classification label
Disables application error messsages (SetErrorMode)
Sample tries to load a library which is not present or installed on the analysis machine, adding the library might reveal more behavior
Runs a DLL by calling functions
Spawns processes
Contains modern PE file flags such as dynamic base (ASLR) or NX
Tries to load missing DLLs
Creates mutexes
Program does not show much activity (idle)
Creates a process in suspended mode (likely to inject code)
PE file contains a valid data directory to section mapping
Binary contains paths to debug symbols
Contains medium sleeps (>= 30s)
Sigma detected: Unsigned DLL Loaded by RunDLL32/RegSvr32
PE file contains a debug data directory

mitre_attack_techniques.signature_description: Adversaries may communicate using application layer protocols to avoid detection/network filtering by blending in with existing traffic.

Creates a DirectInput object (often for capturing keystrokes)
